net.tmachine.gpg.hue
Class ContextManager

java.lang.Object
  net.tmachine.gpg.hue.ContextManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.util.EventListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener
public class ContextManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener

All input for the viewport is directed to this class, enabling it to keep track of cursor position, current button and keystates, etc.

setDocument

public void setDocument(Document d)
The Document is a simple MVC Model containing data on what shapes there are, where they are, etc; it has all the data that would be "saved" if there were a load/save feature in this demo!

Parameters:
d -

getDocument

public Document getDocument()
The Document is a simple MVC Model containing data on what shapes there are, where they are, etc; it has all the data that would be "saved" if there were a load/save feature in this demo!

setControlComponent

public void setControlComponent(javax.swing.JComponent c)
Informs this class which component it has to listen to to get input events etc so that it can correctly maintain it's context

Parameters:
c - Generally the main renderer component (i.e. this class will listen to key and mouse events that happen on the main renderer)

getCursorPosition

public int[] getCursorPosition()
Returns:
the (x,y) co-ords of the cursor in the same co-ord system used by the painting/rendering logic

setRelativeCursorPosition

public void setRelativeCursorPosition(int x,
                                      int y)
Sets cursor position ignoring any special transformations performed on the rendering surface (this method then automatically applies those transformations to the incoming co-ords before storing them)

Needed because Sun's windowing system for Java is incapable of maintaining a single consistent co-ordinate space for rendering and events.

TODO: doesn't currently do anything special; transformed-painting-surface support isn't added yet

Parameters:
x -
y -
